Class BattlePlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleshipprojekt3.BattlePlayer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BattleComputerPlayer

    public class BattlePlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class describes a player in the game.

      private java.lang.String name 
      protected int[][] printBoard
      printBoard interprets the field tileBoard 0=empty, 1=part, 2=miss and 3=hit.

      The number of rows in the game.

    • Method Detail

      • initTileBoard

        public void initTileBoard()
        Initiate the tileBoard objects.

      • initShip

        public void initShip(int shipLength,
                     java.lang.String shipName)
        Placing out the actual ship on the tileBoard. For now this method is empty and only the subclass BattleComputerPlayer overriden method is filled up with logic. (In the future if one wants to upgrade this project in the sense that a real person could play the game, this method should be upgraded.
        Parameters:
        shipLength - length of the ship.
        shipName - name of the ship.

      • clearBoard

        public void clearBoard()
        Clearing the tileBoard objects.

      • setBoardState

        public void setBoardState(int row,
                          int col,
                          java.lang.String newState)
        sets boardstate "hit", "miss", "part" or "empty" on given row and colon in {#tileBoard}.
        Parameters:
        row - given row.
        col - given colon.
        newState - given state, it could either be: "hit", "miss", "part" or "empty".

      • getBoardState

        public java.lang.String getBoardState(int row,
                                      int col)
        Parameters:
        row - given row.
        col - given colon.
        Returns:
        a state of chosen tileBoard objects. The states are be: "hit", "miss", "part" or "empty".
